The linting command has revealed numerous ESLint errors and warnings in your codebase. Based on the GitHub issue you referenced and the current output, here are the main categories of issues:

## Summary of Lint Issues:

1. **Unused Variables/Imports** - Many variables and imports are defined but never used
2. **TypeScript `any` Types** - Multiple instances of explicit `any` types that should be more specific

---

Great! We've eliminated the ESLint configuration warning. Now we have a cleaner output with just the actual code issues. Let me create a comprehensive solution to address the most common issues systematically.

Based on the [GitHub issue you referenced](https://github.com/coryhouse/react-slingshot/issues/151), let me create a script to help fix many of these issues automatically:

---

```diff
- 
+ #!/usr/bin/env node
+ 
+ /**
+  * Script to automatically fix common ESLint issues
+  * Based on the patterns found in the codebase
+  */
+ 
+ const fs = require('fs');
+ const path = require('path');
+ const { execSync } = require('child_process');
+ 
+ // Common patterns to fix
+ const fixes = [
+   // Remove unused NextResponse imports when not used
+   {
+     pattern: /import { NextRequest, NextResponse } from ['"]next\/server['"];?\n/g,
+     replacement: (match, content) => {
+       // Check if NextResponse is actually used in the file
+       if (!content.includes('NextResponse.')) {
+         return match.replace(', NextResponse', '');
+       }
+       return match;
+     }
+   },
+ 
+   // Fix unescaped apostrophes in JSX
+   {
+     pattern: /(['"])[^'"]*?don't[^'"]*?\1/g,
+     replacement: (match) => match.replace(/don't/g, "don&apos;t")
+   },
+ 
+   // Fix let to const for variables that are never reassigned
+   {
+     pattern: /(\s+)let (\w+) = /g,
+     replacement: '$1const $2 = '
+   }
+ ];
+ 
+ function fixFile(filePath) {
+   try {
+     let content = fs.readFileSync(filePath, 'utf8');
+     let modified = false;
+ 
+     fixes.forEach(fix => {
+       if (typeof fix.replacement === 'function') {
+         const newContent = fix.replacement(null, content);
+         if (newContent !== content) {
+           content = newContent;
+           modified = true;
+         }
+       } else {
+         const newContent = content.replace(fix.pattern, fix.replacement);
+         if (newContent !== content) {
+           content = newContent;
+           modified = true;
+         }
+       }
+     });
+ 
+     if (modified) {
+       fs.writeFileSync(filePath, content);
+       console.log(`Fixed: ${filePath}`);
+     }
+   } catch (error) {
+     console.error(`Error fixing ${filePath}:`, error.message);
+   }
+ }
+ 
+ function findTSXFiles(dir) {
+   const files = [];
+ 
+   function traverse(currentDir) {
+     const items = fs.readdirSync(currentDir);
+ 
+     for (const item of items) {
+       const fullPath = path.join(currentDir, item);
+       const stat = fs.statSync(fullPath);
+ 
+       if (stat.isDirectory() && !item.startsWith('.') && item !== 'node_modules') {
+         traverse(fullPath);
+       } else if (stat.isFile() && (item.endsWith('.ts') || item.endsWith('.tsx'))) {
+         files.push(fullPath);
+       }
+     }
+   }
+ 
+   traverse(dir);
+   return files;
+ }
+ 
+ // Main execution
+ console.log('🔧 Starting automatic lint fixes...');
+ 
+ const srcDir = path.join(process.cwd(), 'src');
+ const files = findTSXFiles(srcDir);
+ 
+ console.log(`Found ${files.length} TypeScript files to check`);
+ 
+ files.forEach(fixFile);
+ 
+ console.log('✅ Automatic fixes completed!');
+ console.log('💡 Run "npm run lint" again to see remaining issues');
```
